tags.name: Execution
tags.description: Execution pipelines as raw or stored

tags.name: Cron
tags.description: Get pipelines cron result and status

tags.name: StoreAlgorithms
tags.description: Store new algorithms, update, get and delete

tags.name: StorePipelines
tags.description: Store new pipelines, update, get and delete

post.description: Start pipeline execution with raw input, returns jobId that can be used as a reference for the pipeline to do actions such as results/status/stop, etc.

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific pipeline

algorithmName.description: Unique identifier representing a specific algorithm

ttl.description: Algorithm execution time to live in seconds. 0 to disable

minStatelessCount.description: Minimum number of stateless nodes to create during pipeline initiation.

maxStatelessCount.description: Maximum number of stateless nodes to scale up to.

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific pipeline

ttl.description: pipeline time to live in seconds (including pending and active states)

activeTtl.description: pipeline active time to live in seconds (only active state)

debugOverride.description: A list of algorithms to debug in this execution

items.description: Unique identifier representing a specific tag

rootJobId.description: the root job id of the current tree

defaultFlow.description: the name of the default stream flow

flows.description:
define streaming flows in simple syntax
example: node A stream to B and C, node B stream to D.
it will be: A >> B&C | B >> D

example.main: A >> B&C | B >> D | C >> E

requestBody.description: an object representing all information needed for pipeline execution

post.description: Start pipeline execution when the name of the pipeline is known, all parameters in this action will be merged with the stored pipeline and then returns jobId that can be used as a reference for the pipeline to do actions such as results/status/stop, etc.

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific pipeline

algorithmName.description: Unique identifier representing a specific algorithm

ttl.description: Algorithm execution time to live in seconds. 0 to disable

define streaming flows in simple syntax
example: node A stream to B and C, node B stream to D.
it will be: A >> B&C | B >> D

example.main: A >> B&C | B >> D | C >> E

requestBody.description: an object representing all information needed for stored pipeline execution

post.summary: Run job from a specific node
post.description: the api allows you to run job from current node and getting the data of the predecessors from caching of the previous run

requestBody.description: an object representing all information needed for stored pipeline execution

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific algorithm

requestBody.description: an object representing all information needed for algorithm execution request

post.description: Call to stop pipeline execution by jobId, pipelineName or startTime

cursor.description: get the next results starting from this cursor

pageNum.description: get the next results starting from this page number

exists.description: only return records that has fields

requestBody.description: jobs search specification

cursor.description: this cursor to the next query can be used for pagination

timeTook.description: the query completion time took in milliseconds

get.description: Returns a list of all jobs (active and pending)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: status of the jobs to return

parameters.name: raw
parameters.description: if true returns just the jobId

get.description: Returns a status for the current pipeline.
returns result for the execution of a specific pipeline run. if called before result is determined - returns error.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Unique identifier representing workflow execution - is given in response to calling pipeline run method .

get.description: Returns a tree of pipelines, usually a triggered pipelines
return results of stored pipelines by given pipeline name
return status of pipelines by given pipeline name
Get tree of pipelines triggers by given name or for all pipelines
return cron results by given pipeline name
return cron status by given pipeline name
return cron list of all stored pipeline

post.description: Start cron by given pipeline name

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific pipeline

post.description: Stop cron by given pipeline name

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific pipeline
Unique identifier representing a specific dataSource

post.summary: Create a new dataSource and upload a file

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific dataSource

items.description: Data file (file types: *)

storage.description:
Contains the credentials and storage information of 
an S3 bucket, If kind is set to "internal" 
no other parameters are required

git.description:
Contains the credentials and Git information,
If kind is set to "internal" 
no other parameters are required

repositoryUrl.description: provide a url to an empty git repository

tokenName.description: the token name is *required* when using a *gitlab* account

requestBody.description: DataSource name and file to upload

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific dataSource
Unique identifier representing a specific dataSource

versionDescription.description: a commit message supplied by the user

get.summary: Fetch a single dataSource by name

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: request a specific version, if not stated the latest is returned

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific dataSource

versionDescription.description: a commit message supplied by the user

post.summary: upload a new file to a given datasource

items.description: Data file (file types: *)

requestBody.description: DataSource name and file to upload

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific dataSource
Unique identifier representing a specific dataSource

versionDescription.description: a commit message supplied by the user

get.summary: list a all the versions of a given dataSource name

post.summary: sync a version from git to the database

requestBody.description: DataSource name

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific dataSource
Unique identifier representing a specific dataSource

versionDescription.description: a commit message supplied by the user

post.summary: create a new snapshot for a given datasource version

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific dataSource

post.summary:
post a query for *preview only*,
the results are NOT persisted to the database
create a new snapshot for a given datasource version

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific dataSource

get.summary: fetch all snapshots for a given datasource

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific dataSource

patch.summary:
update the credentials for the git repository and the storage
updates throughout the entire version history of a dataSource by its name

requestBody.description: New credentials to update

201.description: number of versions updated with the new credentials

get.summary: fetch snapshots for a given datasource

parameters.name: resolve
parameters.description: return the entire dataSource with the snapshot

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific dataSource
Unique identifier representing a specific dataSource

versionDescription.description: a commit message supplied by the user

requestBody.description: a list of file ids to include in the generated zip file

get.summary: download an archive of the selected files

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: request a specific version, if not stated the latest is returned

200.description: ensure a datasource exists by name, version or snapshot

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: algorithm name to get from the store

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific algorithm

algorithmImage.description: image name as in the docker registry

workerCustomResources.description: Custom resource limits and requests for the algorithm worker - overrides defaults for THIS algorithm.

reservedMemory.description: Reserved memory for HKube's operations such as in-memory cache, higher value means faster data retrieval and less algorithm memory, lower value means slower data retrieval and more algorithm memory

devMode.description: runs algorithm with mounted sources to allow rapid development cycles

opengl.description: should algorithm support XGL context creation (mount X socket)

mounts.description: a list of volumes to mount into the algorithm

pvcName.description: name of an existing kubernetes pvc (persistent volume claim)

path.description: the mount path in the algorithm container

volumeType.description: Special volume types such as emptyDir

url.description: a url for the git repository

branchName.description: the branch name you wish to create a build from

tag.description: a specific tag which will trigger the build

token.description: a token which allows hkube's build system to access private repositories more information https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-a-personal-access-token-for-the-command-line

dependencyInstallCmd.description:
Command to run to install algorithm dependencies. CWD is the algorithm root folder
Defaults to language specific defaults.
e.g. For python: pip install -r requirements.txt

baseImage.description: Custom docker image to be used as base to the newly built algorithm image

minHotWorkers.description: how many live algorithm instances will always run

maxWorkers.description: Maximum number of workers for this algorithm. 0 marks no limit

quotaGuarantee.description: The amount of algorithms required to be scheduled first in a case of cluster pressure

algorithmEnv.description: key value environment variables for algorithm

workerEnv.description: key value environment variables for worker

nodeSelector.description: key value labels for nodes constraint

labels.description: attach key value metadata to algorithm pod, usually for users

annotations.description: attach key value metadata to algorithm pod, usually for tools and libraries

downloadFileExt.description: the extension name that will be attached to a file when downloading algorithm result

sideCars.description: a list of sideCars for the algorithm

container.description: key-value pairs of names and images for containers

items.description: Fill one of the volume types (emptyDir, PVC, CM, Secret)

volumeMounts.description: key-value pairs of names and mountPaths

environments.description: key value environment variables for sideCar

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: algorithm name to get from the store

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: should also delete all related data, e.g. pipelines, builds, versions.

schema.description: Unique identifier representing a specific algorithm

name.description: Unique identifier representing a specific algorithm

algorithmImage.description: image name as in the docker registry

workerCustomResources.description: Custom resource limits and requests for the algorithm worker - overrides defaults for THIS algorithm.

reservedMemory.description: Reserved memory for HKube's operations such as in-memory cache, higher value means faster data retrieval and less algorithm memory, lower value means slower data retrieval and more algorithm memory

devMode.description: runs algorithm with mounted sources to allow rapid development cycles

opengl.description: should algorithm support XGL context creation (mount X socket)

mounts.description: a list of volumes to mount into the algorithm

pvcName.description: name of an existing kubernetes pvc (persistent volume claim)

path.description: the mount path in the algorithm container

volumeType.description: Special volume types such as emptyDir

url.description: a url for the git repository

branchName.description: the branch name you wish to create a build from

tag.description: a specific tag which will trigger the build

token.description: a token which allows hkube's build system to access private repositories more information https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-a-personal-access-token-for-the-command-line

dependencyInstallCmd.description:
Command to run to install algorithm dependencies. CWD is the algorithm root folder
Defaults to language specific defaults.
e.g. For python: pip install -r requirements.txt

baseImage.description: Custom docker image to be used as base to the newly built algorithm image

minHotWorkers.description: how many live algorithm instances will always run

maxWorkers.description: Maximum number of workers for this algorithm. 0 marks no limit

quotaGuarantee.description: The amount of algorithms required to be scheduled first in a case of cluster pressure

algorithmEnv.description: key value environment variables for algorithm

workerEnv.description: key value environment variables for worker

nodeSelector.description: key value labels for nodes constraint

labels.description: attach key value metadata to algorithm pod, usually for users

annotations.description: attach key value metadata to algorithm pod, usually for tools and libraries

downloadFileExt.description: the extension name that will be attached to a file when downloading algorithm result

sideCars.description: a list of sideCars for the algorithm

container.description: key-value pairs of names and images for containers

items.description: Fill one of the volume types (emptyDir, PVC, CM, Secret)

volumeMounts.description: key-value pairs of names and mountPaths

environments.description: key value environment variables for sideCar
